title: Potential way to improve cancer surgery outcomes by managing nontraditional risk factors

title_detail.value: Potential way to improve cancer surgery outcomes by managing nontraditional risk factors

summary: In a study of 142 patients preparing for cancer surgery, researchers say they have evidence that psychological or social risk factors such as depression, limited resilience and lack of emergency resources along with standard medical risk factors such as high blood pressure or diabetes are linked with higher risks of surgical complications.
